postcontent:
I have a few 80% polymer lowers (reinforced around the critical areas, such as the buffer tube) with the jigs (guides that clamp on over the lower to show you exactly where to drill your holes) and screws needed.  These are the G150 model (2nd gen) and normally run $100 plus shipping.  These do not include any drill bits (I can include one new set of the drill bits and mill bit for an extra $25).

These are perfectly legal to transform at home into an AR-15 rifle or pistol lower without needing to get the manufacturing stamp from the ATF.  They have no serial numbers, which is why they're sometimes called "ghost" guns because there's no way to track them.  It only requires a drill or Dremel (drill press is easiest, or you can use a mill), and being polymer it's a lot faster and easier to drill and hollow out the requisite spaces than aluminum to make a lightweight gun to add to your collection.  All you have to do is drill/cut out the red part in the fire control group and drill the holes as indicated on the jig and you'll have a stripped lower for your project.
